original: rgyal ba kun dang spyod yul gcig par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun dang spyod yul gcig par 'gyur //

analyzed: rgyal bas ji skad gsungs pa'i chos nyid ni //
translated: The reality which the Victor has taught

original: de las go 'phang rnyed dka' gzhan med do //
analyzed: de las go 'phang rnyed dka' gzhan med do //

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thob pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thob pa ni 'bras bu ste /

original: sangs rgyas pa la rnyed par dka' ba gzhan med cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la rnyed par dka' ba gzhan med cing /
translated: There is no other state which is difficult to attain for the enlightened one,

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis khyab par snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyal bas ji skad gsungs pa'i chos nyid ni //
analyzed: rgyal bas ji skad gsungs pa'i chos nyid ni //
translated: The reality which the Victor has taught

original: shin tu rnam dag ces pa ni de lta bu'i chos nyid rnam par dag pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so zhes pa ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag ces pa ni de lta bu'i chos nyid rnam par dag pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so zhes pa ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
translated: The words extremely pure refer to the pure nature of things as taught by the Transcendent Lord Vairocana. The words the compiler refer to Vajradhara.

original: yangs pa'i chos ni zab la 'grib med cing //
analyzed: yangs pa'i chos ni zab la 'grib med cing //

original: mnyam med 'jig rten phan byed de la ni //
analyzed: mnyam med 'jig rten phan byed de la ni //
translated: In that incomparable benefit for the world,

analyzed: rnam dag rnam par sbyangs te spyad par gyis //

original: zhes pa la de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos de @9a * //
analyzed: zhes pa la de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos de @9a * //
translated: The Dharma of that nature

original: la rnam par rtog pa spangs te spyad par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: la rnam par rtog pa spangs te spyad par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: you should practice, having abandoned conceptual thought.

original: yangs pa'i chos ni zab la 'grib med cing //
analyzed: yangs pa'i chos ni zab la 'grib med cing //
translated: The Dharma is vast, profound, and inexhaustible.

original: zhes pa ni chos nyid rnam par dag pa de rgya che zhing mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'grib ba'am /üîΩ'gog pa med ces pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos nyid rnam par dag pa de rgya che zhing mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'grib ba'am / 'gog pa med ces pa ste /
translated: That pure nature of things is characterized by vastness and immutability, so it is said to be inexhaustible or unceasing.

original: chos nyid de'i rang bzhin spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid de'i rang bzhin spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is a general indication of the nature of that reality.

original: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de zhes pa nas /
translated: Lord of Secrets, there is a knowledge mantra called the intoxicating lord of the desire realm.

original: 'di lta ste dper na gsang sngags kyis ni me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na gsang sngags kyis ni me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like this: for example, a mantra can make the heat of fire disappear and make it cold.üîΩSons of good family, by these words of example, you should have manifest faith in the power of mantra.

original: rigs kyi bu dag dpe'i tshig 'di rnams kyis gsang sngags kyi mthu la mngon par dad par bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis sngags kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang mthu dang 'bras bu rnams bshad la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag dpe'i tshig 'di rnams kyis gsang sngags kyi mthu la mngon par dad par bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis sngags kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang mthu dang 'bras bu rnams bshad la /
translated: This explains the cause, nature, power, and result of mantra.

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin ni gong du yi ge la sogs pa'i nang du bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin ni gong du yi ge la sogs pa'i nang du bshad do //
translated: The cause and nature are explained above in the section on syllables and so on.

original: skabs 'dir ni sngags kyi mthu bstan par bshad de /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni sngags kyi mthu bstan par bshad de /

original: de yang sgrub pa po yid gnyis dang the tshom can gang dag bsgrub pa la the tshom du gyur pa dang / grub pa thob bam mi thob snyam du the tshom za ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags kyi mthu rnams bstan pas bsal te /
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa po yid gnyis dang the tshom can gang dag bsgrub pa la the tshom du gyur pa dang / grub pa thob bam mi thob snyam du the tshom za ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags kyi mthu rnams bstan pas bsal te /
translated: Furthermore, the power of the mantra taught below dispels the doubts of those practitioners who are uncertain and have doubts about practice, or who doubt whether or not they will attain accomplishment.

original: de la rab ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug chen po'i rig sngags kyis lha'i bu thams cad spyod par 'gyur ba dang gzugs khams kyi dbang phyug chen po la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rig sngags las byung ba'i mthu ste gnyis bshad do //
analyzed: de la rab ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug chen po'i rig sngags kyis lha'i bu thams cad spyod par 'gyur ba dang gzugs khams kyi dbang phyug chen po la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rig sngags las byung ba'i mthu ste gnyis bshad do //
translated: The best is explained as the power of the mantra of Mahesvara of the desire realm, which causes all sons of gods to engage in conduct, and the power of the mantra called Manah-svaha arising from the Mahesvara of the form realm.

original: mig 'phrul mkhan gyi sngags kyis spyod pa dang lha ma yin gyi sngags kyis sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams ma rdu 'bring du bshad do //
analyzed: mig 'phrul mkhan gyi sngags kyis spyod pa dang lha ma yin gyi sngags kyis sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams ma rdu 'bring du bshad do //
translated: The medium is explained as the conduct by the mantra of a magician and the illusion and so forth by the mantra of the demigods.

original: dug dang rims la sogs pa med par byed pa dang ma mo rnams kyi sngags kyis 'chi bar byed pa dang / me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang por byed pa rnams mthu tha mar bshad do //
analyzed: dug dang rims la sogs pa med par byed pa dang ma mo rnams kyi sngags kyis 'chi bar byed pa dang / me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang por byed pa rnams mthu tha mar bshad do //
translated: The spells of the mamos that cause death, and the spells that make fire cold and not hot are explained as the lowest power.

original: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de zhes pa ni 'dod pa ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de zhes pa ni 'dod pa ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams la spyod pa'o //
translated: Lord of Secrets, there is a knowledge mantra called 'intoxicating the lord of the desire realm' - desire refers to engaging in form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: khams kyi dbang phyug la zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i gnas rim pa drug gi dbang phyug la mos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de /
analyzed: khams kyi dbang phyug la zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i gnas rim pa drug gi dbang phyug la mos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de /
translated: 'Lord of the realm' refers to the knowledge mantra called 'causing devotion' to the lord of the six levels of the divine abodes of the desire realm.

original: khams der skyes pa @9b rnams rang bzhin gyi rig sngags dang ldan pas rig sngags de bsams pa'am /
analyzed: khams der skyes pa @9b rnams rang bzhin gyi rig sngags dang ldan pas rig sngags de bsams pa'am /
translated: Those born in that realm naturally possess the knowledge mantra, so by merely thinking of that knowledge mantra

original: brjod pa tsam gyis 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod pa tsam gyis 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: or uttering it, they will possess the enjoyment of the five desires.

original: des 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu thams cad myos pas brgyal bar byed cing zhes bya ba la myos pa zhes pa ni mi dran zhing dbang po mi gsal bar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi rig sngags de'i mthus lha'i bu rnams 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod
analyzed: des 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu thams cad myos pas brgyal bar byed cing zhes bya ba la myos pa zhes pa ni mi dran zhing dbang po mi gsal bar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi rig sngags de'i mthus lha'i bu rnams 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod
translated: It causes all the sons of the gods who live in the desire realm to become intoxicated and faint.

original: la chags shing zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la chags shing zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúintoxicated‚Äù does not mean that they become unconscious and their faculties become unclear; rather, by the power of that knowledge spell, the sons of the gods become attached to and cling to the enjoyments of the five senses.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur pas na 'dod pas myos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur pas na 'dod pas myos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are under the power of desire, they are said to be intoxicated by desire.üîΩIt also shows them delightful places that are filled with many different flowers.

original: me tog mang po sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs nyams dga' ba rnams kyang ston zhes pa ni de la me tog sna tshogs ni ldum ra dang me tog gi tshal dang yid du 'ong ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / me tog dang tshal de dag kyang dri zhim zhing kha dog shin tu mdzes pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: me tog mang po sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs nyams dga' ba rnams kyang ston zhes pa ni de la me tog sna tshogs ni ldum ra dang me tog gi tshal dang yid du 'ong ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / me tog dang tshal de dag kyang dri zhim zhing kha dog shin tu mdzes pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúmany different flowers‚Äù refers to gardens, flower groves, and delightful parks, and those flowers and groves are adorned with beautiful colors and sweet scents.

original: sa phyogs nyams dga' ba'i rab dang rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i lding khang la sog pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs nyams dga' ba'i rab dang rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i lding khang la sog pa ston pa'o //
translated: The teacher emanates a celestial mansion adorned with various jewels in a delightful place.

original: yongs su spyad pa dang nye bar spyad pa rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs rnams kyang mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod dang nye bar spyad pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su spyad pa dang nye bar spyad pa rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs rnams kyang mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod dang nye bar spyad pa ste /
translated: Having emanated various different kinds of enjoyments and utensils, refers to the enjoyments and utensils of the five kinds of sense objects.

original: bza' ba'i kha zas dang lha'i gos rab tu bzang zhing 'jam pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bza' ba'i kha zas dang lha'i gos rab tu bzang zhing 'jam pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: They are the food of sustenance and the divine garments that are very good and soft, and so forth.

original: mngon par sprul pa ni gnas de na lha'i bu rnams rang rang gi rig sngags kyi mthus 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par sprul pa ni gnas de na lha'i bu rnams rang rang gi rig sngags kyi mthus 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: Emanation means that in that place, by the power of their own knowledge mantras, the divine sons produce the enjoyments of the five kinds of sense objects.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang sbyin la bdag nyid kyang yongs su spyod do zhes pa de la gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces pa ni rang gi mthu las 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung ba rnams lha'i bu mo rnams la'ang sbyin la de
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang sbyin la bdag nyid kyang yongs su spyod do zhes pa de la gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces pa ni rang gi mthu las 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung ba rnams lha'i bu mo rnams la'ang sbyin la de
translated: He gives to the gods of Controlling Others' Emanations and also enjoys himself.

original: dag kyang yongs su spyod do //
analyzed: dag kyang yongs su spyod do //
translated: Controlling Others' Emanations means that the five kinds of desired objects arise from their own power and he gives them to the celestial maidens and they enjoy them.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa la sogs pa yid bzhin du spyod kyang bdag nyid de la ma chags par spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa la sogs pa yid bzhin du spyod kyang bdag nyid de la ma chags par spyod do //
translated: Similarly, the bodhisattva enjoys offerings to the Tathagata and so forth just as he wishes, but he does not enjoy them with attachment to self.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: lha'i dbang phyug chen po la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de zhes bya ba ni rig sngags de bsams pa tsam gyis sems can gyi don bya ba dang ji ltar 'dod pa'i gnas de dag tu skad cig yud tsam gyis phyin par 'gyur bas na
analyzed: lha'i dbang phyug chen po la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rig sngags yod de zhes bya ba ni rig sngags de bsams pa tsam gyis sems can gyi don bya ba dang ji ltar 'dod pa'i gnas de dag tu skad cig yud tsam gyis phyin par 'gyur bas na
translated: The great lord of gods has a knowledge mantra called swift mind which means that by merely thinking of that knowledge mantra, he can benefit sentient beings and go to whatever place he wishes in an instant.

original: yid mgyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid mgyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called swift mind.

original: des stong gsum gyi stong chen @10a * //
analyzed: des stong gsum gyi stong chen @10a * //
translated: It is said that the light from that [jewel] illuminates the trichiliocosm.üîΩ

analyzed: po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can gyi dgos pa byed cing zhes pa /
translated: It benefits sentient beings in the trichiliocosm.

original: de la stong gsum gyi stong chen po ni steng 'og kun la bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la stong gsum gyi stong chen po ni steng 'og kun la bya ba'am /
translated: Here, the trichiliocosm is the entire upper and lower regions,

original: de ma yin par gzugs kyi khams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la bya la /
analyzed: de ma yin par gzugs kyi khams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la bya la /
translated: or it is the world system of the trichiliocosm of the form realm.

original: stong gsum ni gzhung las grags pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum ni gzhung las grags pa'o //
translated: The trichiliocosm is well known from the scriptures.

analyzed: sems can gyi dgos pa ni gzugs kyi sems can rnams la rig sngags de'i mthus 'og nas 'byung ba'i longs spyod la sogs pas sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is that through the power of that knowledge mantra, sentient beings benefit from enjoyments and so on as will be explained below.üîΩHaving emanated all enjoyments and complete enjoyments,

original: nye bar spyad pa dang yongs su spyad pa thams cad kyang mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni de la kha zas kham gyi zab dang dril sogs pa khyad par du mi spyod la /
analyzed: nye bar spyad pa dang yongs su spyad pa thams cad kyang mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni de la kha zas kham gyi zab dang dril sogs pa khyad par du mi spyod la /
translated: here one does not enjoy food such as morsels and liquids in particular.

original: longs spyod gzhan ni lhag ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: longs spyod gzhan ni lhag ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The other enjoyments are similar to the remainder.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i rigs kyi lha'i bu rnams la yang sbyin la bdag nyid kyang kun du spyod do zhes pa gzugs kyi khams de na gtsang ma'i rigs kyi lha rnams la yang sbyin la /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i rigs kyi lha'i bu rnams la yang sbyin la bdag nyid kyang kun du spyod do zhes pa gzugs kyi khams de na gtsang ma'i rigs kyi lha rnams la yang sbyin la /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyang rig sngags kyi mthu las byung ba'i longs spyod la spyod pa'o //
translated: They give to the gods of the pure abodes in the form realm and they themselves enjoy the resources that arise from the power of their knowledge mantra.

original: 'di yan chad ni rig sngags kyi mthu rab tu bstan pa yin no //üîΩ'di lta ste dper na mig 'phrul mkhan ni gsang sngags rnams kyis kun dga'i rab dang mtsho dang 'bab chu dang mi la sogs pa rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs ston to zhes pa ni mig 'phrul gyi sngags gyi mthu bshad de de yang gang zhe na

translated: Up to this point, the power of knowledge mantra has been taught.üîΩFor example, a magician displays various different things such as parks, lakes, rivers, people and so on through his mantras.üîΩThis explains the power of the mantra of magic. What is that?

original: / mig 'phrul gyi sngags mkhan ni gsang sngags rnams kyis zhes pa ni dbang po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: / mig 'phrul gyi sngags mkhan ni gsang sngags rnams kyis zhes pa ni dbang po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang lha ma yin 'thab pa'i tshe na /
translated: A magician displays various different things such as parks, lakes, rivers, people and so on through his mantras.

original: sngags kyis grangs med pa'i lha'i dbang po rnams su sprul nas lha ma yin rnams kyi mig bslu ba dang / gang la brgal pa'i gtol med par mig 'phrul gyi mthus byed pa'o //

translated: By means of mantra, they emanate as countless lords of the gods and deceive the eyes of the demigods, and by the power of their magical illusions, they are unassailable.

original: mig 'phrul gyi sngags kyi mthu las kun dga'i rab bzang po dang / mtsho dang 'bab chu dang mi la sogs pa sngags kyi mthus mngon par spyod cing ston to //
analyzed: mig 'phrul gyi sngags kyi mthu las kun dga'i rab bzang po dang / mtsho dang 'bab chu dang mi la sogs pa sngags kyi mthus mngon par spyod cing ston to //
translated: By the power of mantra, they display and manifest all kinds of delightful things, such as lakes, waterfalls, and people.

original: 'di lta ste dper na lha ma yin rnams ni gsang sngags kyis skyu ma rnams ston to zhes pa ni lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi mthu bshad de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na lha ma yin rnams ni gsang sngags kyis skyu ma rnams ston to zhes pa ni lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi mthu bshad de /
translated: For example, by means of mantra, the demigods display fruits. This explains the power of the mantra of the demigods.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

analyzed: lha ma yin dang dbang po la sogs pa'i lha rnams 'thab pa'i tshe na lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi mthus lha ma yin grangs med par sprul pa dang / sgra gcan gyi gzugs lha ma yin @10b gyi gnas nas ri'i rgyal po ri rab las 'phags pa'i lus su gyur nas lha rnams skrag pa dang mthus byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgyu ma rnams ston pa'o //

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i stobs /

original: aa bzhi po 'di ma skyes pa'i sgra 'byung ba las rnam par rig pas na bum pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyang ma skyes pa'i tshig tu 'du bar 'gyur ba'i aa bzhi po chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyi stobs zhes bya ba la
analyzed: aa bzhi po 'di ma skyes pa'i sgra 'byung ba las rnam par rig pas na bum pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyang ma skyes pa'i tshig tu 'du bar 'gyur ba'i aa bzhi po chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas kyi stobs zhes bya ba la

original: sogs pas bye brag tu gsungs te /
analyzed: sogs pas bye brag tu gsungs te /

analyzed: aa de rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig tu gyur pas na chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas zhes bya'o //

translated: Arising from a single tone means that the individual words such as vase arise from a single sound that is unborn.üîΩHaving pervaded the entire realm of phenomena, becoming equal to space means that the sound of the unborn pervades the entire realm of phenomena, like space.

original: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam par byas nas zhes pa ste /

original: yi ge aa ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin te rnam pa bzhi ni byang chub de yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste byang chub dang / sbyod pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnams su reg pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //

translated: The letter A is the nature of enlightenment. The four aspects are enlightenment endowed with four branches, like touching enlightenment, conduct, universal awakening, and nirvana.

analyzed: de dag byung mthag tu de nas yang chos kyi dbyings thams cad nges par sgrogs pa'i sgo dag nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi snying po'i tshig gis mtshan pa rnam par rig pa'i dbyangs kyi sgra gcig nas gcig tu mngon par grag go zhes pa
translated: After they arose, then from the doors of proclamation of the entire realm of reality, the sound of the awareness of the syllables of the essence of perfect complete buddhahood resounded from one to another.

analyzed: zhes pa nas /

original: nang gi bdag nyid rnam dag pas //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid rnam dag pas //
translated: With inner purity,

analyzed: rtag tu mngon par brtson par bya //
translated: always be diligent.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis de ltar ma skyes pa'i sgra 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thos nas ngo mtshar du gyur te de'i rjes su bsngags pa bcom ldan 'das la slar gsol pa'o //

translated: Up to here, the unborn sound pervading all worldly realms, having been heard by the bodhisattvas, they were amazed and then praised it, offering it back to the BhagavƒÅn.üîΩThen, the accomplishment of the essence of perfect complete buddhahood arises.

original: de nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi snying po rnams sgrub pa 'byung ste zhes pa nas nam mtshan ma byung gi bar ji srid du 'dug par bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis sgrub pa'i sngon rol du byang chub kyi sems bsgom par bya ba bshad deüîΩ/ de yang skyed mos tshal lam gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i gnas ming smos @13b pa'am /

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas bdag nyid sems gang du dga' bar 'dug ste bsgom mo //

analyzed: de la skyed mos tshal dang phug ni lus dben par bya ba'i gnas so //

analyzed: sems gang du dben pa de gtso bas der 'dug ste /

analyzed: mtshan ma byung gi bar de srid du 'dug par bya'o zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚Äú One should stay there until the signs arise‚Äù is the connection.

analyzed: mtshan ma yang skabs 'dir ni sngags bzlas pa las nad med pa dang bru ba mi tsha ba la sogs pa byung ba la mi bya'i /
translated: As for the signs, in this context they are not the arising of health, the absence of hunger, and so on, from the recitation of the mantra.

analyzed: bsam gtan la sems brtan zhing mi 'byung bar gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: They are the stability and immobility of the mind in meditative concentration.üîΩThen, having taken up any one of those essences,

analyzed: de nas snying po de dag las gang yang rung ba cig gzung ste zhes pa nas nam mkha' ltar gzod ma nas zhi ba ste /

original: de la sgra gnas par bsam zhing mnyam par gzhag pas bzlas brjod bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi sems goms par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sgra gnas par bsam zhing mnyam par gzhag pas bzlas brjod bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi sems goms par bya ste /
translated: Up to this point, one should cultivate the spirit of enlightenment in the manner described above.

original: mtshan ma byung nas rang gi lha'i gzugs su sbyar ba goms par bya ba dang de'i snying gar me long gi dkyil 'khor la sangs rgyas kyi sku bsam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku'i snying gar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang bzlas pa'i sngags bsam te /

translated: When the signs arise, one should cultivate the union with the form of one's deity, and in the heart of that deity one should visualize a moon mandala upon which is the form of the Buddha, and in the heart of the Buddha's body one should visualize a moon mandala and the mantra of recitation.

original: de'i rim pa yang 'di'o //
analyzed: de'i rim pa yang 'di'o //
translated: The stages of this practice are as follows.

original: aa rnam pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba cig snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bsams la /
analyzed: aa rnam pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba cig snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bsams la /
translated: One should visualize any one of the four aspects of the letter A upon a moon mandala in one's heart.

analyzed: aa de'i sgra chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes pa la dmigs shing rang gi phung po lnga gzod ma nas ma byung ma skyes pa'i sbyor ba'am /
translated: One should focus on the sound of that A, which is the statement, All phenomena are primordially unborn, and one should apply oneself to the realization that one's five aggregates are primordially unarisen and unborn.

original: rdul phran du zhig pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas stong pa nyid du gzhig ste /
analyzed: rdul phran du zhig pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas stong pa nyid du gzhig ste /
translated: Having destroyed it with the emptiness of the analysis of the atom and so forth,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la aa gnas pa tsam 'ba' zhig yod par bsams te /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la aa gnas pa tsam 'ba' zhig yod par bsams te /
translated: only the mere presence of the A in the moon disk is imagined.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang aa nyid kyang gong ma'i tshul gyis dmigs su med par ba shig ste ji tsam 'dod kyi bar du stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya'o //

translated: Then, the moon disk and the A itself are also destroyed by the above method, and one should actualize the samadhi of emptiness for as long as one wishes.üîΩThen, by the power of compassion, one should arise from that samadhi and, by the method of conviction in the illusion-like, imagine that A in the region of the heart.

original: de nas snying rje'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin de las langs te sgyu ma lta bur mos pa'i tshul gyis aa de snying ga'i phyogs su bsams nas de las 'od sgro zhing bsdu ba'i sbyor bas rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur bar bya ste /üîΩde yang the @14a * //

translated: From that, by the method of radiating and gathering light rays, one should transform into the form of one's deity.

original: tshom med par rang gi lha'i gzugs su snang bar 'gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: tshom med par rang gi lha'i gzugs su snang bar 'gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: Moreover, one should do that without doubt until one appears in the form of one's deity.

original: de la sbyir lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sbyir lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In that regard, there are three aspects of the transformation into the form of the deity.

original: gcig ni phyag rgya dang sngags sbyar pas lha'i gzugs de bdag go snyam par mos btsam mo //
analyzed: gcig ni phyag rgya dang sngags sbyar pas lha'i gzugs de bdag go snyam par mos btsam mo //
translated: The first is merely the imagination that the form of the deity is oneself, by the application of the seal and the mantra.

analyzed: gnyis pa ni rtag tu goms pa'i dbang gis rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su the tshom med par gsal bar snang ba'o //
translated: The second is the clear appearance of one's body as the form of the deity, without doubt, by the power of constant practice.

original: gsum pa ni sbyor ba'i mthus rang gi lus brjes te lha'i lus su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sbyor ba'i mthus rang gi lus brjes te lha'i lus su gyur pa'o //
translated: The third is the transformation of one's body into the body of the deity by the power of application.

original: de la skabs 'dir ni rtag tu goms pa'i dbang gis rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su gsal bar snang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir ni rtag tu goms pa'i dbang gis rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su gsal bar snang ba la bya'o //
translated: Here in this context, it is the clear appearance of one's body as the form of the deity by the power of constant practice.

original: de ltar rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su bsgyur nas de'i snying po aa cig bsams te /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su bsgyur nas de'i snying po aa cig bsams te /
